name: Oh no! More Clichés. Part 5 Quiz | Idioms and Proverbs | 10 Questions

questions.text:
Complete this well known expression meaning to shift the responsibility to someone else.
"To pass the ______"
questions.explanation:
buck.

	US President Truman famously had a sign on his desk saying "The buck stops here".

questions.text:
Which word is missing from this cliché?
"An iron hand in a ______ glove"
questions.explanation:
velvet.

	This expression means to be firm, resolute and determined while appearing to be gentle and compassionate.

questions.text:
Can you fill the blank in this saying?
"That's the way the ______ crumbles"
questions.explanation:
cookie & cooky & cookey.

	"That's the way the cookie crumbles" means you must accept your fate, and what is going to happen will happen.

questions.text: Which of these definitions fits the expression "in the pink"?
questions.explanation:
To be in good health.

	If you are fully fit and in tip-top condition then you are said to be "in the pink". This is thought to relate to the garden flowers pinks (genus Dianthus) - as in full bloom.

questions.text:
What completes this fishy cliché?
"Packed in like ______"
questions.explanation:
sardines.

	Used to describe many people jammed into an enclosed space, this expression comes from the number of sardines that will neatly fit into a small tin.

questions.text:
Which word completes this expression?
"As scarce as hen's ______"
questions.explanation:
teeth.

	As a hen has no teeth, this cliché means very rare or non-existent.

questions.text: What is the meaning of the saying "To move heaven and earth"?
questions.explanation:
To make a considerable effort.

	One could not make more effort than that described. This expression is thought to be of English origin and more than 200 years old.

questions.text:
Fill the blank in this common expression meaning a kind person.
"He would give you the ______ off his back"
questions.explanation:
shirt.

	This saying is believed to have first been coined some 250 years ago. It portrays a generous and helpful person who is prepared to give away essential items in order to help others.

questions.text: What is the best explanation of the cliché "To make a mountain out of a molehill"?
questions.correct: Making too much of a minor issue
options: Working hard to increase your assets
questions.explanation:
Making too much of a minor issue.

	This expressing is more than 400 years old and means to make too much of a small problem. The ancient Greeks had a saying with a similar meaning, "to make an elephant of a fly."

questions.text: If someone takes an action with which they are not comfortable, it is said to "Go against the ______."
questions.explanation:
grain.

	This expression derives from the working of wood. It is easier to work with the grain when planing wood, it also gives a better end result.  The performance of an action with which one is not comfortable creates a sense of unease that is similar to the physical difficulty of working against the grain of wood.
